DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of the present study is to determine whether the use of an abdominal binder is effective in the non-pharmacological management of orthostatic hypotension in patients suffering from Parkinson's disease
DOC.brief_title: Abdominal Binder to Treat Orthostatic Hypotension (OH) in Parkinson's Disease (PD)
DOC.criteria: Idiopathic PD Hoehn & Yahr stadium < or = 4 Age: 4090 Laboratory confirmed neurogenic orthostatic hypotension (NOH) Stable pharmacological therapy in the last 6 weeks Full legal competence Other major neurologic or psychiatric diseases Untreated diabetes mellitus with clinical features of peripheral neuropathy Major cardiac diseases (ischemic, structural, arrhythmias) Evidence of varices (venous insufficiency stage > or = C2, "varicose veins") Known or suspected pregnancy Breast feeding
